alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Globe, Miami; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; San Carlos; Southeast Gila County; Superior; Tonto Basin (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 4:21PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gila, Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 500 PM MST... At 421 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Tonto National Monument, or 11 miles southeast of Roosevelt, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Globe, Miami, Queen Valley, Central Heights-Midland City, Tonto National Monument, Top-Of-The-World, Claypool, Inspiration and Roosevelt Estates. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 228 and 272. AZ Route 70 between mile markers 253 and 256. AZ Route 77 between mile markers 168 and 170. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Globe, Miami; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; San Carlos; Southeast Gila County; Superior; Tonto Basin
